title: Heera & Panna Bridal Grandeur: The Royal Jadau Haaram
materials: 22K Gold base with Hyderabadi Polish. Adorned with meticulously set
high-quality uncut diamonds (Polki/Jadau) and vibrant Zambian Emeralds (Panna). Features lustrous South Sea Pearls.
features: An opulent Jadau Haaram showcasing traditional South Indian craftsmanship. The floral design is intricately set with uncut diamonds, creating a dazzling effect. Emeralds add a touch of regal elegance. The central pendant features a similar design, cascading down to a larger emerald. Dangles of luminous South Sea Pearls soften the overall look. The 'kundan' setting, typical of Hyderabadi jewelry, adds depth and dimension.
colors: complemented by the vivid green of the emeralds and the soft white of the pearls. A classic and auspicious color combination in Telugu weddings.
occasions: and other significant celebrations. A heirloom piece to be cherished for generations.
description: This Jadau Haaram is a testament to superior craftsmanship and traditional Hyderabadi artistry. The combination of uncut diamonds and emeralds is both timeless and luxurious. The meticulous setting and attention to detail ensure this piece will be a cherished heirloom. Its grandeur makes it a perfect statement piece for any special occasion. A symbol of prosperity and good fortune, making it an auspicious choice for brides.
